articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in C (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in C (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio in C is a four-note arpeggio that consists of the notes C (root), E (minor 3rd), G# (major 7th), and B (major 9th). It has a unique and sophisticated sound due to the combination of a minor 3rd and a major 7th interval.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (C)
- Minor 3rd (E)
- Major 7th (G#)
- Major 9th (B)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio is commonly used in jazz music, fusion, and other genres that require more complex and colorful harmonies. It adds a rich and mysterious flavor to the music, often creating a sense of tension and intrigue due to the dissonant intervals within the arpeggio.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Minor Major 7th arpeggio in C:
1. **"Blue Bossa"** by Kenny Dorham
2. **"Impressions"** by John Coltrane
3. **"Spain"** by Chick Corea
